sentences: Henri Edmond Émile Challan (12 December 1910 in Asnières – 18 February 1977 in the 14th arrondissement of Paris) was a French composer and music educator.
He was a pupil of Jean Gallon and Henri Büsser and was appointed a professor of harmony in 1936.
That same year he won both the first and second prize at the Prix de Rome.
Intermezzo for tuba or bass saxhorn and piano (1970)
